metadata.title: CVE-2018-5131 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Under certain circumstances the "fetch()" API can return transient localcopies of resources that were sent with a "no-store" or "no-cache" cacheheader instead of downloading a copy from the network as it should. Thiscan result in previously stored, locally cached data of a website beingaccessible to users if they share a common profile while browsing. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.7 and Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
